name: Can I Con You into Taking This Quiz? | Humanities | 15 Questions

questions.explanation:
consent.

	Related words and expressions include "consenting adults," "parental consent," and "consentual sex."

convent.

	Queen Guineviere went to live in one after she betrayed King Arthur with Sir Lancelot.

questions.text: An amenity such as a public toilet?
questions.explanation:
convenience.

	A "convenience store" is one that is close by and open most of the time, such as 7-11. A "marriage of convenience" is one entered into primarily for gain rather than affection.

contact & connect.

	American football is a "contact sport." If you are "out of contact" with someone, you haven't communicated for awhile.

questions.text: To be kind and thoughtful is to show _______.
questions.explanation:
consideration.

	In the novel "Pride and Prejudice," the heroine's mother, Mrs. Bennet, is always asking her husband to show some consideration for her "poor nerves."

conflagration.

	A conflagration is a large, disastrous fire. This word is composed of con + flag + ration.

consumption.

	If pulmonary tuberculosis is not stopped, the body wastes away, or is "consumed." Yuck. Showoff spendthrifts with money to burn practice "conspicuous consumption."

questions.text: A competition or a verb meaning "to dispute"?
questions.explanation:
contest.

	You can win a contest or contest a will.

confabulate.

	This word's root is the Latin word "fabula," or story.

questions.text: As Jiminy Cricket sang to Pinocchio, "Always let your ______ be your guide!"
questions.explanation:
conscience.

	A "crise de conscience" is a moral crisis. A conscientious person does his or her best.

questions.text: A marine mollusk with a spiral-shaped shell?
questions.explanation:
conch.

	Pronounced like "conk," as in "conk out." Did you know that conch shells are often used to make cameos?

questions.text: To baffle, frustrate, or mix up?
questions.explanation:
confound.

	You can confound an evil scheme, or a math problem can confound you.

consternation.

	Antonyms include sangfroid and aplomb.

questions.text: An antiquated word for a daily walk taken to promote good health?
questions.explanation:
constitutional.

	A person's constitution is his or her general physical health. (So, someone with a strong constitution can combat disease well.)

concupiscence.

	This word has the same root as "cupid."
